args:
Melsa made a deal with Harle in order to free
Sylvia. However, he had no intention of keeping
his word, and had, in fact, transformed the
dragon into Hypnos' true body. In order to save
Sylvia, the prince and his allies return once
more to the space between worlds.
Heh heh heh. The fools do not disappoint.
And now...it's time to finish this!
Ahead is the place where I think Harle\nmay be hiding.
Er, but as I said, that is merely a guess.\nP-perhaps we should just go back?
We've come all this way, Melsa. It would\nbe foolish not to find out for sure.
Yeah! And if Harle's here, we can squeeze\nSylvia's location outta him!
Okay, what's going on? Why are you being\nsuch a weirdo all of a sudden?
Heh. You really are something, Melsa.
Huh? Where did that come from?
From me, dummy! I mean, you're CLEARLY\nworried, and yet you feel like you have to\nkeep it all bottled up inside.
And look, that's nice and noble or\nwhatever, buuuut...
It's okay for you to start trusting me.\nIf something's wrong, just tell me!
We're BESTIES, man. That's what we do!
...Run. ...RUN! This is all an Empire trap!
Melsa, what did you mean about this\nbeing a trap?!
We'll deal with that later, Elly—right now,\nwe have to engage the enemy!
Why would you say that?\nWhy are you apologizing?
You're confusing me, Melsa...\nYou're making it sound like this is\nyour fault somehow...
I'm sorry, all right? I'm sorry, I'm sorry,\nI'M SORRY!
This can't be happening... This is a prank,\nright, Melsa? Tell me it's a prank!
My, my. Do you truly not understand?\nOr is it that you simply don't want to\nacknowledge the truth?
The heck are you talking about?!
I used her to lure you here.
Oh, and it's not just this time—the people\nof that village have been under my sway\nfrom the very beginning!
Wait, so having her come to the castle and\nask for our help was YOUR idea?!

Indeed! All was as I directed!
I told them that if they wanted
to save Sylvia and their village,
they must obey me.
I've done everything you asked, Harle.\nNow return Sylvia to us.
Yes, I'll not delay the heartfelt\nreunion a moment longer...
For Sylvia stands in front of you now!\nBehold her new and glorious form!

And what a glorious test subject she is!
I infused a dragon with black mana and
transformed it into a fiend under my
complete control!
Ahhh ha ha ha! Now get them, my pet!\nCall forth an infinite number of copies!
Wipe out the prince! His friends!\nThe village! ALL OF THEM!
Huh?! The hell's that in the distance?\nIt must be big if we can see it from here...
That's where the village is!\nIt looks like Hypnos!
Not another Hypnos! How many copies\ncan it even create at once?!
Harle! You promised me! You swore that\nyou would spare Sylvia and my people if\nI obeyed you!

Ah, your utter stupefaction is delightful!
Although I suppose it WOULD be a bit
much to watch one's former guardian
dragon lay waste to their own village.
Sylvia, stop! Please, you have to stop!
Aaaah ha ha ha! Call out all you want!\nYour words are wind!
Now, embrace your own despair and DIE!
Enough, Harle! I won't let you hurt Melsa\nor her people any more!
Good Prince {player_name}!\nYou can't POSSIBLY mean to forgive this\ngirl after her betrayal, mmm?
She was only trying to protect something\nimportant to her.
Melsa isn't our enemy—our enemy is\nthe Empire that would use her in such\na vile way!
Yeah! How dare you hurt Melsa like this,\nyou stupid jerk!
No one hates you, Melsa. Now let's\nstick together and finish this thing\nonce and for all!
If we can do something about the black\nmana they're using to control Sylvia,\nshe might return to her normal self.
Such keen insight! Yes, if you defeat\nHypnos entirely, the black mana will\nindeed disappear.

And why am I telling you this, you ask?
Because such a thing is impossible!
Even a group with your obscene luck
cannot stand against the might of Hypnos!
...He's right. We fought the fiend before\nand couldn't completely defeat it.
It doesn't matter! There's still a chance!
I... I'm sorry, {player_name}.\nI'm just not brave like you.
When Sylvia disappeared, you were the\none who challenged that powerful fiend!
Well, yes—but that is because I was\nworried about Sylvia.
It's incredibly brave—AND kind—to care\nenough about someone to fight for them.
I have only the smallest amount of bravery,\nso I don't think I could fight on my own...
But knowing I have my bestie Sarisse on\nmy side is enough to make me TRY!
You've made everyone suffer, Harle,\nbut your time is over!
I will never lose to you! I WILL save Sylvia!
You go, girl! Sock it to him!
